pageContext.claim: “I have lowlife dummy John Bolton, a war mongering fool, violating the law (he released massive amounts of Classified Information) and an NDA in order to build badly needed credibility and make a few dollars.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump accused his former national security adviser, John Bolton, of including classified information in his book, "The Room Where It Happened," which paints Trump as an incompetent commander-in-chief. Bolton, a careful operator with decades of Washington experience, has denied the accusation and his lawyers say that career officials cleared the book for publication after reviewing the manuscript for classified information, but that political appointees at the White House later overruled the career officials to claim that the book did contain state secrets.
